name: Unity Productions Foundation
mission: In this 3-hour series for TV & streaming, a young Muslim Couple travels along historic Route 66, discovering their American roots and the many stories of Muslims enriching America. Along the way, they learn how Muslims are a part of American spirituality, food, technology, music and much more.
programs: The Great American Muslim Road Trip
UPF Film - The Sultan and the Saint
UPF Film - American Muslims: Facts vs. Fiction
theoryOfChange: Using the power of media and film-based dialogues to break down stereotypes, counter dehumanizing rhetoric, and enhance religious and cultural pluralism.
zakatClaimEvidence: The Unity Productions Foundation website and donation pages, as well as information from Charity Navigator, do not explicitly mention 'zakat' or dedicated zakat funds. The available information details various donation methods such as online gifts, donor-advised funds, IRA funds, Amana Funds, wills, and trusts, but no specific mention of zakat. (Source: https://www.upf.tv/ways-to-donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: ibn_sabil (+5)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 29/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Unity Productions Foundation shows strong impact and good alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: The Unity Productions Foundation website and donation pages, as well as information from Charity Navigator, do not explicitly mention 'zakat' or dedicated zakat funds. The available information details various donation methods such as online gifts, donor-advised funds, IRA funds, Amana Funds, wills, and trusts, but no specific mention of zakat. (Source: https://www.upf.tv/ways-to-donate/)

all_citations.claim: UPF earned a Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 76.1%.
The organization reported total revenue of $2,774,622.
UPF conducts teacher workshops and provides educational discussion guides to influence social relations.
The foundation reaches global viewers through video lessons and media content.
The organization maintains detailed IRS financial reporting for its $2,774,622 in revenue.
The organization accepts various forms of charitable giving and sadaqah.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: UPF earns a 70/100 GMG score due to its exceptional financial accountability and specialized impact in media advocacy, though its niche focus results in a medium alignment for general donors.
areas_for_improvement: Medium donor fit for those seeking direct humanitarian relief rather than advocacy
Reliance on capacity-building models which can be harder to measure than direct aid

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization offers a medium donor fit as its mission focuses on advocacy and media representation rather than direct social services [1]. While it is a sadaqah-eligible entity, its work is categorized under cause urgency for advocacy, appealing to donors interested in long-term cultural change and countering stereotypes [8].
dimension_explanations.impact: UPF demonstrates high impact through capacity building, reaching global audiences and conducting teacher workshops to improve social relations [3][5]. With a program expense ratio of 76.1% and a cost per beneficiary of approximately $34.98, the organization efficiently utilizes its $2,774,622 in revenue to influence public perception [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Unity Productions Foundation counters bigotry and media stereotypes by fostering authentic Muslim narratives in film and television.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 76.1% ensuring most funds support media initiatives
Strong financial health with 13.1 months of working capital
Excellent fundraising efficiency at $0.22 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Unity Productions Foundation (UPF) is a media-focused nonprofit that addresses social caricatures of Muslims through professional film production and industry advocacy [3][5]. The organization reported a total revenue of $2,774,622 and maintains a high level of financial transparency, earning a Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100 [1][7].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: UPF earns a 70/100 GMG score due to its exceptional financial accountability and specialized impact in media advocacy, though its niche focus results in a medium alignment for general donors.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization has experienced a <cite id="2">-36.7% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>, indicating a need for more consistent funding streams.
As an advocacy organization, measuring direct outcomes is challenging compared to traditional relief charities.

bbb_assessment.summary: BBB Wise Giving Alliance assessment data is not currently available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains over 13.1 months of working capital to weather revenue fluctuations.
risk_factors: <cite id="2">-36.7% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite> indicates recent funding volatility.
Media advocacy outcomes are difficult to quantify compared to direct humanitarian aid.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns for donors involve recent revenue contractions and the inherent difficulty of measuring advocacy impact.

confidence.notes: Strong financial transparency but typical challenges in measuring advocacy outcomes.

known_gaps: Detailed impact evaluations of media campaigns

alignment.explanation: UPF is a sadaqah-eligible organization that fits donors interested in long-term cultural advocacy and media representation rather than immediate crisis relief.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust UPF due to its <cite id="1">97.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and its Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid, indicating high accountability.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, UPF could publish more detailed annual impact reports linking specific media projects to measurable shifts in public perception.

impact.explanation: UPF demonstrates strong financial health with <cite id="1">13.1 months of working capital</cite> and an efficient <cite id="2">76.1% program expense ratio</cite>.
impact.improvement: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes but limited causal evidence

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: UPF is an operating foundation that produces its own media rather than making grants.

rich_narrative.headline: Unity Productions Foundation counters bigotry and media stereotypes by fostering authentic Muslim narratives in film and television.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to combat Islamophobia through long-term cultural change and media representation, and are comfortable with sadaqah-only giving.
donor_motivations: Care deeply about authentic Muslim representation in media
Want to counter bigotry and stereotypes at a systemic level
Value educational outreach and cultural dialogue
giving_considerations: Impact is measured in viewership and cultural shifts rather than lives saved
Media production requires significant upfront investment
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill their zakat obligations or those looking to fund immediate humanitarian crisis relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates that while the organization tracks outputs like viewership and workshops, rigorous causal evaluation of media impact is limited.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: UPF creates high-quality films for worldwide broadcast and educational campaigns to increase understanding and counter bigotry.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: In media advocacy, tracking actual shifts in audience perception is crucial to ensure that films effectively counter stereotypes rather than just reaching sympathetic viewers.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a recent decline in revenue, the organization has capacity to absorb more funding to return to previous production levels.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its specific focus on professional film and television production.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses more broadly on policy and Hollywood engagement rather than direct film production.
similar_organizations.name: Muslim Public Affairs Council

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses on legal advocacy and civil rights rather than media production.
similar_organizations.name: CAIR

strengths.detail: UPF maintains a <cite id="2">76.1% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring the vast majority of funding goes directly to media and advocacy initiatives.
The organization demonstrates highly efficient fundraising, spending just <cite id="1">$0.22 per $1 raised</cite>.
UPF holds strong reserves with <cite id="1">13.1 months of working capital</cite>, providing stability for long-term media projects.

strengths_deep_dive: Unity Productions Foundation excels in maintaining financial stability while executing high-cost media projects. The organization's <cite id="2">76.1% program expense ratio</cite> and <cite id="1">$0.22 per $1 raised</cite> fundraising efficiency indicate a lean operational model. Furthermore, its <cite id="1">97.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> reflects strong governance and accountability practices, supported by a <cite id="1">100/100 Culture and Community beacon score</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Unity Productions Foundation (UPF) is a media-focused nonprofit established in <cite id="2">1999</cite> that addresses social caricatures of Muslims through professional film production and industry advocacy. The organization works to counter bigotry by fostering authentic Muslim narratives in film and television. In its most recent filings, UPF reported <cite id="2">$2,774,622 in total revenue</cite> and demonstrated strong financial efficiency with a <cite id="2">76.1% program expense ratio</cite>. The organization maintains high transparency standards, earning a <cite id="1">97.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and holding a Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid. Through its various initiatives, including film production and educational outreach, UPF has reached an estimated <cite id="5">150,000,000 global viewers</cite>.
